content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is how you can do it:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in the markdown document
    code_blocks = findall(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seperators=true)
    
    # Remove code fences from each block and join them with a newline
    joined_code = join([replace(block[1], "\n" => "") for block in code_blocks], "\n")
    
    return String(joined_code)
end
```
This function works by using regular expressions to find all the code blocks in the markdown document, then removing the fences from each block and joining them with a newline. The resulting string will contain all of the Julia code found in the markdown document with the code fences removed.
